title: Man accidentally shoots himself in the head, police confiscate handgun
content:
BATTLE CREEK, MI -- Friends drove a 24-year-old Battle Creek man to the hospital early Thursday morning after he shot himself in the head with a handgun, according to a new study release from Battle Creek City police.
At 3:56 a.m Oct. 27 police were called to the first block of West Fountain Street on reports of a man with a gunshot wound to the head.
Authorities said it appears the man was with friends when he was handling a handgun. The firearm discharged resulting in him being struck in the head.
Officers were assisted by detectives in this case. The firearm was located and has been confiscated.
The man's condition was not immediately available.
